#summary Engine functions are the base functions use to initialize, start, and stop GMOgre3D.
<br>
<br>
----
=== InitializeOgre3D(string plugins_cfg, string ogre_cfg, string log_file) ===
----
Initializes the GMOgre3D engine.  This needs to be called before any other GMOgre3D functions are called.
==== Parameters ====
  * plugins_cfg - The file location to the plugins.cfg file.  Note this is only needed if you are not using the static version of GMOgre3D.
  * ogre_cfg - The file location to store the last used OGRE settings
  * log_file - The file location for the OGRE log file 
<br>
----
=== IsOgre3DInitialized() ===
----
Initializes the GMOgre3D engine.  This needs to be called before any other GMOgre3D functions are called.

<br>
----
=== StartOgre3DEngine(real render_engine, real hwnd, real window_width, real window_height) ===
----
Starts the GMOgre3D engine.  After calling this all drawing of the GM window is taken over by the GMOgre3D DLL.

====Parameters====
  * render_engine - The type of renderer to use. Can be global.RENDER_DX9 or global.RENDER_GL
  * hwnd - The window handle
  * window_width - The width of the window
  * window_height - The height of the window
<br>
----
=== StopOgre3DEngine() ===
----
Shuts down the GMOgre3D engine.  After calling this GM is again able to draw to the GM window.
